subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] On a keyboard
msgSnippet: ... Right. ... I don t think it s practical or necessary to build a new keyboard. Move the ten digits on the top row to the shift positions on the QWERTY row.
messageBody:
Jean-François Colson skribis:
>
> amd64_hacker wrote:
> >
> > What sort of layout should a QS keyboard have
> > anyway?
>
> Let's take a very wide text written in QS and estimate
> the frequency of each character. After that it would be
> relatively easy to make a Dvorak QS keyboard for
> English.

Right.


> tim_rice09 wrote:
> >
> > A possible answer to this, build a new keyboard
> > that may not even have to have a shift key.


I don't think it's practical or necessary to build a new
keyboard. Move the ten digits on the top row to the
shift positions on the QWERTY row. Now you have
36 keys on four rows. That's almost enough for the
QS letters. Place the least used letters in a shifted
position and the next least used letters on the top row.

--Ph. D.
